intro: Euryops latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Its leaves are broad and lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euryops latifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
